thread.title: La Salle turns back UE, grabs solo 3rd
thread.title_full: La Salle turns back UE, grabs solo 3rd | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Christian Jacinto
title: La Salle turns back UE, grabs solo 3rd
text:
by Christian Jacinto
October 15, 2015 Games Saturday
(Mall of Asia Arena)
2 p.m. – Ateneo vs Adamson
4 p.m. – UST vs NU
La Salle survived a big third quarter surge by University of the East (UE) before getting its bearings back in the payoff period to eke out a 72-64 victory and move to solo third in the UAAP basketball tournament yesterday at the Smart Araneta Coliseum.
The Green Archers nearly lost an 11-point halftime lead but Jeron Teng, Prince Rivero and Larry Muyang alternated at the hoops bridging the third and fourth periods to keep the Red Warriors at bay.
La Salle’s Thomas Torres (right) fights three University of the East players in a mad scramble for the ball during yesterday’s UAAP game at the Smart Araneta Coliseum. The Green Archers won, 72-64. (Ernie U. Sarmiento)
Teng had 20 points, six rebounds and three assists as La Salle bounced back from Sunday’s 81-79 loss to co-leader University of Santo Tomas (UST) for a 5-4 record, half-game ahead of rival Ateneo (4-4) for third.
“Hard-fought game,” said La Salle coach Juno Sauler. “We had a good lead in the first half, UE got back but it’s a good thing the players were able to get their composure back and finish the game well.”
Amid a strict policy imposed by the Big Dome security that irked several members of the media, La Salle’s lead was threatened in the third when UE used a 14-4 run capped off by a Chris Javier basket to pull within 45-44.
The Archers slowly regained their form behind Teng, Rivero and Muyang to lead 55-50 entering the fourth before a 9-0 blast turned a 62-58 lead into 71-58 on Joshua Torralba’s three with two minutes remaining.
The win, however, failed to satisfy Teng, who thought La Salle lacked energy.
“Feeling ko kulang kami sa energy,” Teng admitted. “UE showed more effort in their pressing and fastbreak.”
Thomas Torres backstopped Teng on offense with 15 points and grabbed five boards. Muyang became a revelation off the bench for the Archers, falling a point shy of a double-double with nine points and 11 rebounds in 22 minutes.
Renz Palma and Javier scored 14 points each for the Red Warriors, who dropped to seventh place at 3-6.
